title: Trump says hopes China, U.S. can reach trade deal
text: U.S. President Donald Trump sharply criticized China's trade practices on Tuesday in an address at the U.N. General Assembly in which he also held out hope that the two economic superpowers could reach a deal to end their trade dispute.

title: Trump tells UN he will not accept a 'bad' trade deal with China
text: Speaking to the United Nations General Assembly, Trump struck an optimistic tone about reaching a trade deal with China.

title: Techs boost Wall Street as trade concerns ease
text: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday, lifted by technology shares, after Washington confirmed that trade talks with China would resume in two weeks, easing some uncertainty fueled by the cancellation of a planned U.S. farm visit by Chinese delegates last week.

title: IEX Calls It Quits In The Listing Business

title: Trade optimism bolsters shares, pound whipsawed by Brexit drama
text: Rekindled U.S.-China trade hopes supported share markets on Tuesday, while Britain's pound was whipsawed by another twist in the Brexit drama as the UK's top court dramatically overruled the government's suspension of parliament.

title: China grants new tariff waivers for purchases of U.S. soybeans: report

title: Stocks Climb On Trade Optimism; Treasuries Edge Up: Markets Wrap
text: European stocks rose with U.S. futures and Asia shares edged up as investors weighed hopes for high-level trade talks this month between America and China against mixed global economic data.

title: Oil prices fall due to weak economic data, Saudi output recovery
text: Oil prices fell on Tuesday after weak manufacturing data from Europe and Japan focused market attention on a gloomy outlook for demand and as Saudi Arabia was expected to restore oil output faster than anticipated following attacks last week.

title: Oil slips as focus shifts from Saudi supply to global demand concerns
